captions.text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and today I wanted
to share with a really quick recipe even

though it really isn't a recipe and I really
debated on making this video except on my

Instagram, a few weeks back, I posted a picture
of my green juice and so many people asked

'What's in it?' 'We want a recipe!' "Make
a recipe on Laura in the Kitchen about what

you put in your green juice'. So that's what
I'm doing today. It might help some of you

that you kind of have no idea where to start.
It definitely was for my husband! He was like

"okay.. What goes in a green juice?" So, this
is what we really really really love. The

recipe that I'm using requires a few ingredients.
I have got some frozen grapes and some frozen

watermelon, I've also got some fresh kale,
raw, make sure it is washed, I've got some

cucumber, lemon, I've got some celery and
then apple and I also have a pinch of cayenne

pepper because the cayenne pepper kind of
balances out the sweetness from the grapes

and apple and also the sharpness of the lemon.
Now obviously this is kind of like the base,

a lot of people will make it kind of similar
to this and this is just kind of what I found,

the mixture that I love. The grapes and the
watermelon, I have it frozen in my freezer

at all times because they are great for cocktails
they are great for smoothies and I find them

to be delicious in this, not only do they
add sweetness, but they also act like ice,

so i don't have to add more ice to it, I mean
you could if you wanted to, but this is how

simple it is. You take a big handful of kale,
I usually use kale, but I also use baby spinach

as well and it works great. Whatever is fresh,
farmers market, what ever is growing around

you, put it in here. I go kind of heavy on
the kale because I have got an iron deficiency,

so dark greens are really really good for
that, so that is why i really go heavy handed

on it, then I take my cucumber, peel and all,
now this is one thing i will say, if you are

going to use the peel or the outside of a
fruit, like i am using the peel of the cucumber

and the peel of my apple, you do want to buy
organic only because that way there is no

pesticides going in your body, not going to
force you to, just telling you to. I've got

my apple in there and I've also got my grapes
and my watermelon, my cayenne pepper and I

am going to squeeze the lemon, well half a
lemon, now i don't put actual pieces of lemon

in it because the white part of the lemon
is really bitter and i don't like the way

that makes my juice taste. So, I don't put
that in - and to help it along, a touch

of water helps. Alright, now, if you don't
have a super powerful blender, you might want

to be careful because you don't want to break
your actual blender and if your using a regular

blender you are going to need to strain this.
I am not going to strain it, I keep it all

in there because I want all the fiber and
every single piece of that vegetable, so it's

fine with me, you could also use your juicer
but I'm in love with this Blendtec so that

is what I am using and I am just going to
hit the whole juice and let it go.

Oh yes! Looks good, smells delicious! I am
going to save that for my husband. I am going

to put his over ice, I don't put extra ice
over mine because I don't like things too

cold, I have very sensitive teeth. This is
like our favorite blend, but I will let you

know, I have substituted peaches instead of
apples, i have put in blueberries, it does

change the color a little bit but hey, it
still tastes really good!. I have added orange,

I have added tons of different things, for
me as long as I have got really good kale,

spinach or any kind of really dark dark green,
is the base for me and then you kind of go

from there. Whatever you like, whatever is
in season, whatever is available in your farmers

market, throw it in there, it's the best!
I drink mine every single afternoon at 3:30

P.M (That's my snack time), When i am home
anyways, it is something that my husband

and I look forward to and it is great! Hop
on over to laurainthekitchen.com to get the

written recipe even though like I said, you
can put whatever you want into it. I hope

you have enjoyed spending time with me and
i will see you next time. Bye!

title: Green Juice Recipe - Laura Vitale - Laura in the Kitchen Episode 620
